title: Suddenly, Jeremy Corbyn wanted an election after all... and Labour MPs looked more miserable than ever
text:
Tell you who I feel sorry for. Barry Gardiner. The man gives Jeremy Corbyn everything. At practically any hour of the day or night, you’ll find him on your TV or radio, stoutly defending his leader’s latest position – no matter how ludicrous that position may be. In fact, the more ludicrous it is, the more stoutly Mr Gardiner defends it. What a pro. What a man. What a hero.

Tragically, however, this noble sacrifice of his time and dignity doesn’t always pay off.

This morning, Mr Gardiner – who otherwise serves as Labour’s spokesman on international trade – was doing his rounds of the studios, defending Mr Corbyn’s reluctance to have an election in December. The proposal, he told the BBC, was...
description: Tell you who I feel sorry for.
